question: Which nation can be associated with the traditional fire-walking ritual "Anastenaria"?
explanation: Anastenaria is a traditional barefoot fire walking ritual of various villages of Bulgaria. Due to the Balkan Wars of 1911-1912, refugees from Bulgaria started spreading this dance to northern Greece as well. It is an annual ritual. The central figures of this tradition are Saint Constantine and Saint Helen. This ritual is now largely played for the tourists in Bulgarian Black Sea coast or Bulgarian Riviera. It also found a place in UNESCO Intangible and Cultural Heritage Lists.
